TITLE: L.A. Workers Are Feeling Emboldened as Unions Pressure Employers in California
SUMMARY: California union members are pressuring employers over wages in one of the nation’s most labor-friendly states.

TITLE: At the Front Lines of the Inflation Fight, Uncertainty Reigns
SUMMARY: Central bankers and economists gathered this week and, amid concerns about persistent inflation, wondered about all the things they still don’t know.

TITLE: Affirmative Action Ruling May Upend Diversity Hiring Policies, Too
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court decision on college admissions could lead companies to alter recruitment and promotion practices to pre-empt legal challenges.

TITLE: Key Inflation Gauge Cooled in May, Welcome News for Federal Reserve
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve is watching to see how much the economy is slowing as it tries to wrangle inflation. Fresh data offered hopeful hints.

TITLE: GDP Data Shows US Economic Growth Rate of 2% in Q1
SUMMARY: Government data showed that G.D.P. rose at a 2 percent rate in the first quarter, better than initially reported.

TITLE: Opposition Grows to U.S. Imports of ‘Laundered’ Russian Oil
SUMMARY: Human rights groups and Ukrainian officials want the United States to stop buying Russian crude oil that has been refined into other products in third countries like India

TITLE: Fed Chair Powell Says He Expects Slower Interest Rate Increases to Continue
SUMMARY: After rapid interest rate increases, Federal Reserve officials could move to a steadily slower pace — though they are not ready to commit.

TITLE: Overstock to Rebrand as Bed Bath & Beyond
SUMMARY: The online retailer is renaming its website and its mobile app after buying the intellectual property of the bankrupt home-goods store.

TITLE: Biden Administration Weighs Further Curbs on Sales of A.I. Chips to China
SUMMARY: Reports that the White House may clamp down on sales of semiconductors that power artificial intelligence capabilities sent tech stocks diving.

TITLE: Facial Recognition Spreads as Tool to Fight Shoplifting
SUMMARY: British merchants are increasingly using the technology to combat shoplifting, raising questions about its spread as artificial intelligence rapidly improves it.

TITLE: In Poorer Countries, Obesity Can Signal Financial Security
SUMMARY: A study found that loan officers in Uganda, where information is scarce, were more likely to offer credit to heavier-looking people.

TITLE: What Is Happening in the Housing Market?
SUMMARY: Home construction surged in May and prices have ticked up, even with interest rates at a 15-year high. The resilience has surprised some economists.

TITLE: Harry Markowitz, Nobel-Winning Pioneer of Modern Portfolio Theory, Dies at 95
SUMMARY: He overturned the traditional approach to buying stocks by examining the relationship between risk and reward.

TITLE: China’s Extreme Floods and Heat Ravage Farms and Kill Animals
SUMMARY: China’s leader has made it a national priority to ensure the country can feed its large population. But weather shocks have disrupted wheat harvests and threatened pig and fish farming.

TITLE: Harvard’s Francesca Gino, Dishonesty Expert, Is Accused of Fraud
SUMMARY: Questions about a widely cited paper are the latest to be raised about methods used in behavioral research.

TITLE: Starbucks Union Raises Pressure With Plan to Strike Over Pride Décor
SUMMARY: Walkouts were called at more than 150 stores in the next week after workers said Pride Month decorations had been banned in some, a claim the company denied.

TITLE: Chinese Firm Sent Large Shipments of Gunpowder to Russian Munitions Factory
SUMMARY: The previously unreported shipments between a state-owned Chinese company and a Russian munitions factory last year raise new questions about Beijing’s role in Russia’s war against Ukraine.

TITLE: Congress Spotlights Forced Labor Concerns With Chinese Shopping Sites Shein and Temu
SUMMARY: A congressional investigation into Temu and Shein offered new insight into services that are delivering a deluge of cheap and little-regulated products.

TITLE: Bank of England Raises Rates More Than Expected, as Inflation Persists
SUMMARY: “We know this is hard,” the central bank’s governor said, after increasing interest rates half a point, to 5 percent.

TITLE: Student Loan Pause Is Ending, With Consequences for Economy
SUMMARY: Three years of relief from payments on $1.6 trillion in student debt allowed for other borrowing and spending — and will shift into reverse.
